ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Indicate if the subject took any medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Not Applicable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The EXYN variable is a cleaning or EDC convention meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. EXOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is preprinted on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable EXOCCUR, since EXOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (EXYN = "Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC SDTM Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response Terminology

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRDS Alternate Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the Subject currently receiving treatment on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient start protocol treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive a benzyl alcohol containing formulation of blinatumomab?
